definition: lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
to drink
to give (animals) water to drink
legendary bird whose feathers can be used as poison/poisonous/to poison sb
to stop/to prohibit/until/only
thirsty

sentences.english: After all, we cannot drink poison to quench thirst when it comes to jobs.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，解決就業難的問題，千萬不能飲鴆止渴。

sentences.english: Someone once said that anger is like drinking poison and hoping your enemy will die.
sentences.chinese: 有人曾經說過憤怒就像飲鴆止渴而希望敵人會死去。

sentences.english: The remedy is worse than the, cannot because thirsty run drink poison.
sentences.chinese: 飲鴆止渴，不能因爲口渴就拼命喝毒藥。

sentences.english: To cut science funding in order to cut the deficit is actually self-defeating.
sentences.chinese: 爲了減少赤字而削減科技經費無異於飲鴆止渴。

definition: to repair a tire
to get straight to the point (idiom)
lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
protective coloration/camouflage
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
methodology
to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: ability/skill
